title: "Unable to Connect, Please Check YOUR Internet Connection and Try Again"
body:
Countless players suffer from this same problem that I have, in which every now and then you start a game, and it disconnects, yet for some reason no matter what you try the disconnects keep happening and the game becomes unplayable. Now, in these situations I HAVE CHECKED and my internet is working perfectly fine and peachy, yet the game simply does not connect. I've tried closing the game and reconnecting from the client, I've tried waiting for the "Attempting to Reconnect" in the {{champion:67}}  hope that it will actually do something, I've tried closing the client and opening it again, I've tried restarting my computer, I've tried resetting my router, and I've even gone as far as to run outside and reset the modem. I've checked around and it seems like I'm not the only one suffering from this, yet in no post do I see an official Rioter response or any attempt to resolve the issue. Honestly, it appears that they've given the players suffering from this issue the classic not us tech support response:

1: Have you tried restarting the game? "Yes."
2: Have you tried restarting your computer? "Yes."
3: Have you tried restarting your router? "Yes."
4: Have you tried re-installing the game? "Yes."
5: Is your computer up to date and does it have the right hardware? "Yes."
6: Can you send us your game logs? "Sure, here they are."
7: Hmmm it looks like the game can't connect to PvP.net. "Yes obviously."
8: Take it up with your internet provider. "What was i expecting." {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} 

Excluding this issue, Riot Support has been EXCELLENT regarding fixing technical issues and I don't know whats going on but it seems like they've turned a blind eye here for some reason or another. For me, the issue comes every once in a while so it's not a daily problem but in those times where it occurs IN THE MIDDLE OF MY PROMOS it really really sucks. So please, Riot Support, {{champion:64}} to us suffering peoples and find a fix for this problem :c

replies.body:
[Here you go.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/scale_xlarge/public/upload/su16_keyart_1920x1080_0.jpg?itok=6nj8mHjj


If you continue to experience connectivity issues;

[Utilise Riot’s Log Reader to see what’s happening with your network.]( https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader)
This is the classic not our fault response I was talking about...

While it may not seem like it, there are some very crucial steps in the connection guide that are necessary in order to troubleshoot the issue you're seeing. When the client is not able to connect to the game server, it's usually caused by either an unstable or a poor connection to the server. A poor connection can prevent you from connecting to the game server or crash your client entirely. There are a number of factors that could cause connection issues, however, the most common are addressed in the Connection Guide. 

Should you still have issues after taking the steps in the guide, let me know.

The connection guide has a number of steps, which I can go through here briefly:

Check the Server Status: In all of the instances where this has happened to me, the servers were up and running fine
Switch to a Wired Connection: I'm always on a wired connection
Firewall Troubleshooting: My firewall has been turned off during games where this has occurred in an attempt to play league without the risk of these issues
Configure Your DNS: I did this the first time i had the problem, and have kept it this way since, but it has no effect
Packet Loss: I have no packet loss issues after running the test.
Packet Buffering: All applications that could cause packet buffering are closed, in fact ALL applications are closed entirely. 
Port Forwarding: Followed the instructions, and all the ports are forwarded
Updating OS: My Mac is updated to the most recent OS (El Capitan)
Administrator Settings: I am the Admin, and have full privileges
VPN and Proxy Use: I am not using a VPN or a proxy 

Everything is compliant with the standards stated in the connection troubleshooting page, and its not simply me but THOUSANDS of players with this problem. I think that if this many players have the same issue despite most of them probably having followed these instructions then its time to consider that perhaps its not a problem with the user but with the server. In some instances I can see everything around me going on but I cant move myself and after a while of that the game disconnects entirely, which sounds... iffy if its an all-round internet problem. Just pointing out quickly, even if you have Packet Loss and Packet Buffering, the page points to other applications and your network provider as well.

Since you've taken the time to ensure your connection is aligned with the guide, it sounds like your connection issue is more advanced than what we normally see. In this case, I'll recommend you [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with our tech specialists. Attaching a set of logs with our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#section-mac) and the link to your completed [Network Analysis](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1) will provide them the information to get to this quickly.

Let me know if you have any questions.

There is more than just a connection issue. i have seen it countless times, on me and other players. I have checked my side nummerous times and I always find that I have perfect connection to everything else on the net, except the LoL server.

The pattern is obvious too, I never have issues with the client, or with the game itself once it is loaded, but I repeatedly run into issues with the Load Screen. It slows down, it get's stuck for a while, it freezes completely, it crashes randomly it looses connection.

Also the issue seems to exist in both in EUW and NA, so it's hard to believe it's  a connection issue rather than a fundamental software flaw.

At some point you have to admit to yourself that there is somethign wrong on your side and fix it. But instead you keep shoving responsibility to us and try to solve the issue with /remake..
